channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: After the war began, French retailer Leroy Merlin closed its Ukraine outlets and stayed in Russia. Then conflict arose between the company and its Ukrainian staff. https://t.co/Wi70D3W6sy

Kentucky lawmakers overrode their governor’s veto and passed new abortion regulations Wednesday, potentially making it the first state in decades without legal access to abortion https://t.co/VM4v2eWteF

The Grand Rapids Police Department released a video Wednesday that showed an officer fatally shooting Patrick Lyoya, a 26-year-old Black man, from behind following a traffic stop https://t.co/Ezdis3hJAo

House Democrats plan to press the Biden administration to take a tougher stance on Saudi Arabia, citing Riyadh’s refusal to cooperate with Washington over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and a range of human-rights issues https://t.co/MGt2zPBknU
Ukraine transformed its rigid Soviet-style military into a Westernized force where soldiers think on the move through years of NATO classes, drills and exercises https://t.co/fdJCti35sz
A cryptocurrency expert who gave a presentation in North Korea on how to use blockchain technology to evade U.S. sanctions was sentenced to 63 months in prison Tuesday https://t.co/tEemRPEV95
Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said countries that maintain their ties to Russia after its invasion of Ukraine risk facing isolation from the global economy https://t.co/9aF7b8iX98
Breaking: The suspected gunman who opened fire in a Brooklyn subway train during Tuesday’s morning rush hour has been taken into custody, police said https://t.co/jKnL2k6Cyb

President Volodymyr Zelensky urged allies to provide heavy weapons to Ukraine, declaring, “Without additional weaponry, this war will become an endless bloodbath, spreading misery, suffering and destruction” https://t.co/jNtgI7u3gT
The U.S. plans to expand the battlefield intelligence it's providing Ukraine's forces so they can attack Russian units in Donbas and Crimea, officials said https://t.co/HCUgQ2IjJd
How did Ukraine transform from a rigid Soviet-style military to a Westernized force? Years of NATO classes, drills and exercises. https://t.co/I7FjGGodm2

The U.K. government Wednesday announced a further set of Russia sanctions against 206 individuals, including six oligarchs and their families, to further pressure the Kremlin in the wake of attacks on civilians in eastern Ukraine https://t.co/ixWMUAHQOi

Russia's oil-storage facilities are filling up, refineries are cutting output and crude-oil wells are reducing production—a blow for the country's economy as Moscow wages war on Ukraine https://t.co/9TVuJs3sEt
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/87lSwC2bft
A U.S. nuclear-powered aircraft carrier has been sent to the waters between South Korea and Japan this week in a display of American naval firepower https://t.co/Jt7MMJr43S

Russian President Vladimir Putin said peace talks with Kyiv had reached a dead end, as Moscow’s forces on Tuesday bombarded Ukrainian military positions and residential areas in the country’s east and unleashed new rocket attack https://t.co/0ZLvLYN8TF

New York police said Tuesday night that the suspect in the Brooklyn subway shooting fired 33 times, and put on a gas mask before opening a canister that filled the train car with smoke https://t.co/jpQLG1kaKR
Obituary: Actor and comedian Gilbert Gottfried, who was known for his distinctive voice, has died at the age of 67 https://t.co/RW6D9fw9oZ

Elon Musk’s decision to not join Twitter’s board of directors has company employees and analysts foreseeing a potential fracas with the world’s richest man #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/icmlCgaFMD https://t.co/LkrkmCk7oR

New York Lt. Gov. Brian Benjamin resigned after being arrested in connection with an alleged bribery scheme and subsequent coverup while he was being vetted to join the administration of Gov. Kathy Hochul https://t.co/GQpAeg9fWU
President Biden called Russian President Vladimir Putin’s actions in Ukraine a genocide, marking the first time his administration has used the term https://t.co/gDv1sCQtH5
Ukraine’s SBU domestic intelligence agency said it detained Viktor Medvedchuk, a Ukrainian ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin who had been on the run https://t.co/y6VQWz21hU

One of the busiest international bridges in the country was effectively shut down after Mexican truckers blocked lanes to protest a new border security initiative from Texas Gov. Greg Abbott that forced them to wait to bring products into the U.S. https://t.co/kMlIq6OoOP

A manhunt is under way for a suspect in the Brooklyn subway shooting that left at least 16 people injured. Schools in the area are in lockdown.
Follow our live coverage. https://t.co/Hcu3Vfa9fU

In his first extended comments on Russia’s war in Ukraine since last month, Russian President Vladimir Putin said that peace talks have reached a dead end and promised that his forces would continue fighting until they finish the job https://t.co/mzOuXNuk9Q

Russia will resume its moon-exploration program, Putin said, paving the way for a new space race as international space cooperation comes under strain following the invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/v64sEN2AwE
New York Lt. Gov. Brian A. Benjamin surrendered to federal authorities after being indicted on public-corruption charges https://t.co/FzDuKf09UH
Breaking: Several people were shot at a Brooklyn subway station and undetonated devices were found at the scene, officials said. At least 13 people are injured. https://t.co/XScJ67DTaB

Ukrainian investigators embarking on a wide-ranging probe of alleged war crimes are using high-tech forensic methods as they search for evidence in the killings of hundreds of people by Russian troops in Bucha https://t.co/2TCgP47fwP
U.S. inflation accelerated to 8.5% in March, a new four-decade high, as surging energy prices and higher food costs hit consumers https://t.co/8EcBknSqdd

After Russia invaded, many Western companies in Ukraine packed up and left. But German auto supplier Leoni found ways to keep production running, saying its workers in Ukraine saw each shift as an act of defiance against Moscow. https://t.co/IlKL0o0MCT
President Biden met virtually with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi as Washington presses New Delhi to take a tougher stance against Russia over its invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/3g5WcJjBHm
A U.S. nuclear-powered aircraft carrier has been sent to the waters between South Korea and Japan this week in a display of American naval firepower https://t.co/YgI7wFcdms

Gen. Aleksandr Dvornikov, the man chosen to lead the next phase of Moscow’s war in Ukraine, was an architect of Russia’s military intervention in Syria, where Russian airstrikes hit civilian targets including hospitals https://t.co/wF7wuBwXmk
The U.S. plans to temporarily allow gasoline with high ethanol content to be sold this summer in a bid to tame high fuel prices, administration officials say https://t.co/5b3JU3MK5g

Architects and builders turn to "mass timber"—an engineered wood product similar in strength to concrete and steel—to build multistory buildings. “When you come inside, the smell of the timber is almost like you enter a forest.” https://t.co/RwyPPlTTxm
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky launched a fresh appeal for military aid as the country prepares for some of the conflict’s heaviest fighting so far https://t.co/MzSvC36tnA
Europe’s largest poultry farm, on Ukraine’s occupied Black Sea coast, has lost almost four million chickens to thirst and starvation during the country’s war with Russia https://t.co/kSGrO5LHGX

A top American Army general in Europe is expected to be elevated to lead all U.S. and allied forces, U.S. officials said, marking the biggest change to NATO military leadership since Russia invaded Ukraine in February https://t.co/IBK6SYA9zU
Covid vaccines carry a low risk of heart conditions such as myocarditis, two studies found. One found it was not much different than the flu shot. https://t.co/9Ibvn31XwZ
Cancún and the Riviera Maya, Mexico’s top tourism spots, are fighting a wave of violent crime. The problem is demand for drugs by tourists. https://t.co/MLyypAOtqD

Elon Musk’s decision not to join Twitter’s board makes him a wildcard for the social media company, paving the way for him to press for changes and speak out freely about the company as an activist investor https://t.co/6a6u81J0ZC
Elon Musk reversed his decision to join Twitter's board, CEO Parag Agrawal said late Sunday. The move comes after Tesla's CEO tweeted criticism about the company. https://t.co/UMKNwn94NG

In El Salvador, more than 9,000 people have been arrested in the past two weeks after legislators gave President Nayib Bukele’s government emergency powers for up to 30 days to curb a record wave of killings that terrorized residents https://t.co/E9YydVFcRi

France said it shut down a Russian intelligence operation on French soil and ordered six embassy employees it said were Russian intelligence agents working under diplomatic cover to leave the country https://t.co/lNhiXpy0sm
Europe’s largest poultry farm, on Ukraine’s occupied Black Sea coast, has lost almost four million chickens to thirst and starvation during the country’s war with Russia https://t.co/RJl9hsOQT9

A top American Army general in Europe is expected to be elevated to lead all U.S. and allied forces, U.S. officials said, marking the biggest change to NATO military leadership since Russia invaded Ukraine in February https://t.co/f4TfjHaizl

Marina Ovsyannikova, the Russian journalist who ran onto the set of an evening news program on Russian state television holding a poster denouncing the war, has joined German daily Die Welt as a freelance correspondent https://t.co/qcM0MCj261
Wildflower season is here. See three weekend getaways where you can bask in the bloom, in the Pacific Northwest, Colorado and the Blue Ridge Mountains. https://t.co/GYlJ4NgqJw

Elon Musk appears to have deleted some tweets taking aim at Twitter amid his decision not to join the social-media company’s board. Over the weekend, the Tesla CEO tweeted criticisms, suggestions and apparent jokes about Twitter. https://t.co/rGwTW4cbNx
